stance_1: I aim to eat smaller portions
stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: The interviewee explicitly links eating smaller portions to health motivations.

stance_1: I alternate beef and turkey weekly
stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: Alternating beef and turkey is explicitly tied to health motivations and dietary management.

stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that eating chicken daily is part of making health-conscious choices.

stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: The desire to maintain good health is directly motivated by the presence of health challenges.

stance_1: I use an air fryer for chicken
stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: Using an air fryer instead of frying is explicitly tied to health motivations.

stance_1: I occasionally eat fried chicken as a treat
stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: Occasionally eating fried chicken as a treat goes against the stated health motivations.

stance_1: I occasionally eat fried chicken as a treat
stance_2: I use an air fryer for chicken
justification: Occasionally eating fried chicken as a treat is in tension with usually using an air fryer for health reasons.

stance_1: I have fond memories of family meals with meat
stance_2: Southern cuisine was a staple growing up
justification: Fond memories are explicitly linked to growing up with Southern cuisine.

stance_2: I have fond memories of family meals with meat
justification: The enjoyment of eating meat is explicitly linked to fond family memories involving meat.

stance_1: I do not feel guilty about eating meat
justification: Not feeling guilty about eating meat supports the enjoyment of it.

stance_1: I eat processed meats like hot dogs
stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: The interviewee acknowledges processed meats are less healthy, conflicting with the health goal.
The interviewee and their family both having health challenges is explicitly stated and mutually reinforcing.

stance_2: My family reduced fried and greasy foods
justification: Family members' health challenges are explicitly said to have motivated reduced consumption of fried and greasy foods.

stance_2: I want to maintain good health
justification: Health challenges motivate the desire to maintain good health.

stance_1: I want to maintain good health
stance_2: My family reduced fried and greasy foods
justification: Reducing fried and greasy foods is directly motivated by health concerns, both for the interviewee and their family.

stance_2: I do not feel guilty about eating meat
justification: Enjoyment of eating meat is supported by the absence of guilt.

stance_1: I aim to eat smaller portions
justification: Enjoyment of eating meat may conflict with the intention to restrict portion sizes, though the evidence is moderate.
